ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: from treasures and a splendid situation.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and their treasures and excellent dwellings.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We deprived them (the unbelievers) of gardens, springs,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And from treasures and nice houses.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Treasures, and every kind of honorable place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and treasures and a noble station;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And treasures and a fair estate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: their treasures and their noble dwellings --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And treasures and a station noble.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and [made them leave behind] treasures and stately homes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Treasures, and every kind of honourable position;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Treasures, and every kind of honourable place.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: their treasures and a noble station.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:58] and treasures, visible riches of gold and silver — these [riches] are called kunūz [as opposed to amwāl, ‘riches’] because that [portion] which is [always] due to God, exalted be He, from them had not been paid — and splendid places, exquisite residences for princes and ministers surrounded by their retinues.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And treasures) wealth (and a fair estate) beautiful houses.
